The Flock of Birds Bus


Functions

void fbFBBReset (fbird *fb)
void fbFBBAutoConfig (fbird *fb, int num)
void fbRS232ToFBB (fbird *fb, int bird)

Detailed Description

If more than one bird is used, then the flock of birds bus or FBB must be properly initialized through the use of fbFBBReset() followed by fbFBBAutoConfig(). As well, for commands that must be directed towards one specific bird the fbRS232ToFBB() function specifies what bird the next command should be sent to.

Function Documentation

void fbFBBReset (  fbird *  fb  ) 
 

Reset the flock. This should be called after fbReset() has been used to reset the first bird in the flock.

Parameters:
fb pointer to an fbird structure

void fbFBBAutoConfig (  fbird *  fb,
int  num
) 
 

Configure the flock for the specified number of birds.

Parameters:
fb pointer to an fbird structure
num the number of birds to configure for
The number of birds connected to the flock can be determined by examining the FB_FBB_STATUS parameter via fbExamineValueBytes(). For each bird that is attached to the flock, the corresponding byte will be nonzero.

void fbRS232ToFBB (  fbird *  fb,
int  bird
) 
 

Inform the flock that the next command is to be sent to a specific bird. This is only applicable to certain commands.

Parameters:
fb pointer to an fbird structure
bird the bird address (1 or greater)
